event.title: named by Olivia Whitemore and Arthur Guinness in 1764

data.event: ( named by Olivia Whitemore and Arthur Guinness in 1764) Beaumont sits at the top of a considerable ascent from Fairview and Georgian Dublin Coastlines.

event.title: 1764 Olivia Whitmore and Arthur Guinness made

data.event: From 1764 Olivia Whitmore and Arthur Guinness made their new family home in Beaumont House.

event.title: took 51 acres (210,000 m2) "more or less situate in the Parish of Coolock" on a lease for the longer of 31 years

data.event: Guinness took 51 acres (210,000 m2) "more or less situate in the Parish of Coolock" on a lease for the longer of 31 years or three lives, and built a house "at Kilmore" ; it is apparent that he later named the property "Beaumont".
